What is the law of conservation of energy?

options.label: A
options.text: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed; it can only be transferred or transformed.

options.label: B
options.text: Energy is directly proportional to mass and the square of the velocity.

options.label: C
options.text: Every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

options.label: D
options.text: The force acting on an object is equal to the mass of the object multiplied by the acceleration.
